com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app
Interface AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic

All Known Subinterfaces:
SmartableActivity<AggregateClass>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractSmartListActivity, AbstractWrappedSmartListActivity, Droid4mizer, ForBusinessObjectActivity, SmartActivity, SmartGroupActivity, SmartListActivity, SmartMapActivity, SmartPreferenceActivity, SmartSplashScreenActivity, SmartTabActivity, WrappedSmartListActivity
Enclosing class:
AppPublics
public static interface AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic

Because an Android Activity can be destroyed and then recreated, following a configuration change (a screen orientation change, for instance), this interface gives information about an entity life cycle.

Since:
2010.01.05
Author:
Édouard Mercier

Method Summary
 int getOnSynchronizeDisplayObjectsCount()
          Enables to know how many times the LifeCycle.onSynchronizeDisplayObjects() method has been invoked, which may be useful when you do not want this method to do something that the LifeCycle.onFulfillDisplayObjects() method may have already done.
 boolean isFirstLifeCycle()
          Is not invoked by the framework, and provides information about the current entity life cycle.
 boolean isRefreshingBusinessObjectsAndDisplay()
          Indicates whether the extending Activity also implementing the LifeCycle interface is in the middle of a LifeCycle#refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean, Runnable) call.
 

Method Detail

isFirstLifeCycle

boolean isFirstLifeCycle()
Is not invoked by the framework, and provides information about the current entity life cycle.

Returns:
true if and only if the entity life cycle is the first time to execute during its container life

getOnSynchronizeDisplayObjectsCount

int getOnSynchronizeDisplayObjectsCount()
Enables to know how many times the LifeCycle.onSynchronizeDisplayObjects() method has been invoked, which may be useful when you do not want this method to do something that the LifeCycle.onFulfillDisplayObjects() method may have already done.

Returns:
the number of time the LifeCycle.onSynchronizeDisplayObjects() method has actually been invoked

isRefreshingBusinessObjectsAndDisplay

boolean isRefreshingBusinessObjectsAndDisplay()
Indicates whether the extending Activity also implementing the LifeCycle interface is in the middle of a LifeCycle#refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean, Runnable) call.

It is very handy when it comes to disable certain things, like menu entries, while an Activity is loading.

Returns:
true if and only if the LifeCycle#refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean, Runnable) is being executed.
